title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 9000.2 - Duration of designations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 9000.2 - Duration of designations

State Regulations
(a) Permanent designation. The Commissioner of Transportation may list by county in
this section, by order filed with the Secretary of State, highways which shall
be permanently designated for preferential use lanes for specified types or
classes of vehicles. (b) Temporary
designations. The Commissioner of Transportation may list by county in this
section, by order filed with the Secretary of State, highways which shall be
temporarily designated for preferential use lanes for specified types or
classes of vehicles. Such order shall specify the duration of such designation
which may be any period less than permanent and may be measured by date or by
the occurrence of specified events such as the completion of projects or
contracts or segments thereof or until further notice by order adopted in like
manner by the Commissioner of Transportation. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
9000.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
